item.title: Five simple steps to saving cash (while still having a life)
item.description: Saving money is not about beating yourself up. It's also not about depriving yourself of all sources of joy.

item.title: Australia's women beaten by New Zealand in Perth Sevens final, but men claim bronze
item.description: The Australian women are forced to settle for silver at the Perth Sevens, while the Aussie men claim bronze in thrilling fashion.

item.title: Kimberley cotton hits record high in first season with new processing gin in Kununurra
item.description: From farm to fabric, West Australian cotton growers are finally able to grow, process and export record amounts of cotton locally.

item.title: 'Punitive' bail law amendments have increased and First Nations people are affected
item.description: A study has found increasing "punitive" bail law amendments are negatively affecting First Nations people.

item.title: ASIO was told about Bondi shooter's terrorist links years before attack, former spy claims
item.description: The former undercover agent spied on the Akrams when he infiltrated a Sydney IS terror cell for Australia's intelligence agency.

item.title: 'Massive' Indonesian ghost barge washes up on tiny Torres Strait island
item.description: The barge drifted into Australian waters from Indonesia after breaking from its moorings during bad weather.

item.title: Tasmanian cartoonist Jon Kudelka and the art of cutting through political spin
item.description: Hailed as an artist who "knew the power of comedy in holding truth to power", Jon Kudelka once described himself as "like a monkey with an automatic rifle".

item.title: More people say they'll vote One Nation. What are they voting for?
item.description: One Nation questions if man-made climate change is real, wants to wind back access to abortion care and plans to pay the HECS debts of doctors working in the regions.

item.title: Roblox on notice after 'disturbing' reports of child grooming
item.description: The government puts popular social gaming site Roblox on notice following media reports of children being approached and groomed by predators on the platform.

item.title: Former ATSIC head Geoff Clark was jailed but his community says legal issues persist
item.description: Former ATSIC leader Geoff Clark was jailed in 2024, yet some members of his community say legal issues linger on.

item.title: Native title holders take appeal over one of Australia's largest groundwater licences to High Court
item.description: The cultural value of water will be front and centre in the High Court in Canberra today as a group of native title holders from Central Australia fight to assert cultural rights over an aquifer under their lands.

item.title: States urged to sign National Water Agreement even though users unaware what's in final version
item.description: As the country's state governments and territories consider signing a new national water policy that seeks to address climate change and elevate First Nations knowledge, the agricultural industry fears it has been overlooked.

item.title: Bondi Beach terrorist Sajid Akram voiced support for Islamic State in 2019, former ASIO agent says
item.description: Bondi Beach terrorist Sajid Akram voiced support for the Islamic State group (IS) in 2019 and expressed admiration for a leading Al Qaeda propagandist, according to accounts from two men who moved in the same extremist circles.

item.title: Commonwealth asks to meet Roblox following reports of child grooming. Here's what we know
item.description: Roblox has been called to an urgent meeting with the federal government in the wake of reports that children are being groomed by predators and exposed to sexually explicit material on the popular online gaming platform.

item.title: Chappell Roan no longer represented by talent agency led by Casey Wasserman
item.description: Pop star Chappell Roan says she is no longer represented by the talent agency led by Los Angeles 2028 Olympics chief Casey Wasserman, who has faced criticism for flirtatious email exchanges with convicted sex trafficker Ghislaine Maxwell more than 20 years ago.

item.title: Shark filmed in deep Antarctic waters
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Elvis Presley 'unguarded' in unseen footage used in new Baz Luhrmann film
item.description: When director Baz Luhrmann and his team uncovered hours of previously unseen Elvis Presley recordings, Luhrmann abandoned his original plans, deciding to "get out of the way" and let Presley tell his own story.

item.title: Health warnings about ultra-processed foods
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Food ministers move closer to mandating Health Star Ratings on packaged food
item.description: The nation's food ministers will this week take a crucial step towards mandating the Health Star Rating scheme on packaged food products.

item.title: How to reduce loneliness while working remotely
item.description: Working remotely can be a lonely experience. Here's what you can do about it.

item.title: Citizen scientists work on 100-million-year-old ichthyosaur fossil in Winton
item.description: Participants from across Australia and the world travelled to outback Queensland to clean up the near-complete ichthyosaur fossil.

item.title: Socceroos striker Mo Toure scores hat-trick on starting debut in English Championship for Norwich
item.description: Mohamed Toure moved to England recently on a $5 million deal and it is already looking like a great decision for the 21-year-old forward.

item.title: What to watch in February, from puppy love to Muppet hijinks
item.description: Kermit, Miss Piggy and the rest of the crew are back to celebrate their 50th birthday with a one-off special that has the potential to turn into a whole new series for the beloved characters.

item.title: Australian fans miss out on World Cup tickets as prices skyrocket
item.description: A host of Australian fans will be denied the chance to watch the Socceroos World Cup campaign amid accusations of price gouging by FIFA as tickets to the tournament soar to astronomical prices.

item.title: US bars Palau senate president and former Marshall Islands mayor over alleged corruption
item.description: A senior Palau politician rejects accusations from the United States Department of State that he accepted bribes from "government, business, and criminal interests from China".

item.title: Australia cruises to victory over Ireland in T20 World Cup opener
item.description: Australia beats Ireland by 67 runs to win its first game at the T20 World Cup, after captain Mitch Marsh was a late out due to testicular bleeding.

item.title: Transparency concerns as Bougainville's Panguna mine that sparked civil war on path to reopen
item.description: The Autonomous Bougainville Government signs a secretive deal to reopen the huge Panguna gold and copper mine that sparked a catastrophic civil war three decades ago.

item.title: Baker Boy talks new album Djandjay, Riverboats festival and family legacy
item.description: The Yolŋu artist known as the Fresh Prince of Arnhem Land is the king of feel-good bilingual bangers. But heavy is the crown.

item.title: James Van Der Beek, star of Dawson's Creek, dies aged 48 after colorectal cancer diagnosis
item.description: The American actor was best known for his starring role as Dawson Leery in Dawson's Creek from 1998 to 2003.

item.title: Darwin traditional owners feel 'bulldozed' by ambitious solar farm company's approach to consultation
item.description: A renewable energy company planning to build a solar farm near Darwin is seeking a court ruling that no native title claim exists at the proposed site.

item.title: Four people charged after alleged discovery of thousands of cannabis plants in NSW Riverina
item.description: Police allege the four people charged were cultivating a large-scale cannabis farm in the Riverina.

item.title: Man faces Mackay court accused of buying boat for drug smuggling
item.description: Police allege the owner of a recently set up fishing company purchased a vessel with illicit funds to facilitate the importation of illegal drugs.

item.title: Chocolate recipes to share some love with the people in your life
item.description: Whether you are into Valentine's Day or not, these chocolate recipes are perfect for sharing some love.

item.title: Barbeques Galore enters receivership as debt burns into bottom line
item.description: Barbeques Galore has plunged into receivership, leaving question marks for nearly 100 stores that employ about 500 staff.

item.title: Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit to implement recommendations for workplace culture overhaul
item.description: Staff at the Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit will be implementing recommended changes to their workplace culture following an independent review.

item.title: Donald Trump's border tsar Tom Homan announces ICE withdrawal from Minnesota
item.description: An immigration crackdown in the Midwestern state has been marred by protests and public anger after the shooting of two US citizens by federal agents.

item.title: 3,100 aged care patients stranded in hospitals as states again press Commonwealth for action
item.description: With the ink still wet on a new hospital deal, state and territory health ministers will today use a meeting with their federal counterpart to call for urgent action on stranded patients.

item.title: ASX boss to depart as another controversy unfolds
item.description: A decade of technology failures, unplanned outages, management upheaval, irate investors and the torching of hundreds of millions of dollars has left the ASX's reputation in shreds.

item.title: Economist Bruce Preston appointed to RBA Board
item.description: The economics professor is the second academic economist added to the board since a review recommended boosting its expertise.

item.title: More than 100 Stolen Generations survivors gather for apology anniversary
item.description: More than 100 Stolen Generations survivors have gathered in Canberra for the apology anniversary. The government is pledging new money to help them heal.

item.title: Thai raid finds Cambodian scam centre had personal details of 300 Australians
item.description: Australia's National Anti-Scam Centre says documents seized in a raid on a Cambodian scam compound contained the phone numbers, names and addresses of 300 Australians.

item.title: Trump repeals power to fight climate change, axes vehicle emissions rules
item.description: President Donald Trump's administration has revoked a scientific determination that has been the central basis for US action to fight climate change.

item.title: Angus Taylor becomes Liberal leader after defeating Sussan Ley 34–17
item.description: Sussan Ley, the first female leader of the Liberal Party, is set to quit politics after losing a leadership vote today.

item.title: Former Tottenham manager Ange Postecoglou says Spurs 'not a big club' in wake of Thomas Frank sacking
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur are "not a big club" because of their policy in the transfer market, former manager Ange Postecoglou has said in the wake of the London club's sacking of head coach Thomas Frank on Wednesday.

item.title: Cooper Woods' mum reacts after stunning gold medal win in Men’'s Moguls
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Albany Woollen Mills' 101 years celebrated via shared love of blankets
item.description: Established in 1925, Western Australia's first and only woollen mill transformed raw wool into fabric and blankets, becoming a cornerstone of Albany's industry before closing in 2002.

item.title: It took 80 years for a woman to become Liberal leader, and 9 months to ditch her
item.description: Sussan Ley vowed to be a different opposition leader, one who consulted widely and listened to her broad church. But it left many wondering what, if anything, she stood for.

item.title: Bangladesh Nationalist Party wins nation's first election since gen Z-led uprising toppled Sheikh Hasina
item.description: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party has won a landmark parliamentary election, according to local TV stations, securing a resounding mandate in a pivotal vote.

item.title: Katie Holmes pays tribute to Dawson's Creek co-star James Van Der Beek in handwritten letter
item.description: In a handwritten letter posted to social media, actor Katie Holmes has paid tribute to her Dawson's Creek co-star James Van Der Beek, who has died. He was 48.

item.title: AFL Origin 2026: Are footy fans still keen on interstate football?
item.description: After a break of more than a quarter of a century, AFL State of Origin returns in Perth tomorrow with a battle between two proud football states, Western Australia and Victoria.

item.title: What to know about the Year of the Horse and Lunar New Year celebrations in Australia
item.description: The Year of the Horse is here and 2026 is a rare "Red Horse" year. Find out what it means, which zodiac animal you are, and how Lunar New Year is celebrated across Australia.

item.title: Bald Archy satirical art prize highlights political victories, a murder trial and protest movements
item.description: From the trial of Erin Patterson to the landslide election victory, 2025 is pilloried in this year's satirical art prize, the Bald Archy.

item.title: Drug vessel MV Raider heading towards Sydney after being stripped of cocaine
item.description: A ship caught carrying five tonnes of cocaine is making its way towards Sydney after being stripped of its cargo.

item.title: To survive, Angus Taylor's Liberals must now get over their self-obsession
item.description: By its new leader Angus Taylor's own admission, the Liberal Party is running out of time to pull out of the nosedive that has it heading towards oblivion.

item.title: Australia in danger of World Cup elimination after 'unbelievable' loss to Zimbabwe
item.description: Australia's hopes of advancing out of Group B are dealt an almighty blow as Zimbabwe claims one of the biggest upset wins in T20 World Cup history in Colombo.

item.title: How do you find modern dating? Share your highs and lows with us
item.description: Whether you've shed tears of joy, sadness or even laughter in the process, we want to hear it all — but keep it under 150 words.

item.title: Out of 38,000 people fined for non-voting in NT local government elections just 3 per cent have paid
item.description: Just 3 per cent of voters fined for not voting in last year’s Northern Territory local government elections have paid the penalty. Debate is growing over whether the system is working — or unfair to voters in remote areas.

item.title: US aircraft carrier redeployed from Caribbean to Middle East as Iran tensions rise
item.description: The United States will send the USS Gerald R. Ford aircraft carrier to the Middle East amid escalating tensions with Iran, according to US media outlets.

item.title: From Japan to Israel, elections are reshaping global politics
item.description: At a time when so much of the global conversation is about the rapid decline of democracy, it is striking what a huge impact elections are having on world events just now.

item.title: Ley didn't define herself by her gender but women might relate to her workplace woes
item.description: The issue for the Liberal Party is not simply the toppling of a female leader. It's also about what happened to that leader while she was in the job.

item.title: Here's what we know about Angus Taylor's policies
item.description: The new Liberal leader has signalled he will pursue a stricter immigration policy and a return to "Australian values" in his first pitch to win back voters.

item.title: Japanese lagers thrive as Kirin and Asahi loom over Australia's beer market
item.description: As record numbers of Australians continue to visit Japan, Japanese brewers have come to dominate our domestic beer market.

item.title: Courtney's doctor operated seven times to treat severe endometriosis experts say she didn't have
item.description: Pathology from Courtney's seven surgeries with Dr Simon Gordon repeatedly showed no signs of endometriosis. The surgeries left her medically infertile.

item.title: Residents in conservative Farrer eye future without Sussan Ley
item.description: Just minutes after deposed Liberal leader Sussan Ley announced her resignation, constituents in her electorate of Farrer began murmuring about change.

item.title: DNA genealogy is changing the way NSW Police investigate cold cases
item.description: Australians looking to learn more about their heritage through commercial ancestry websites could be helping police solve cold cases.

item.title: NSW Waratahs defeat Queensland Reds 36-12 in opening round of Super Rugby Pacific
item.description: The NSW Waratahs are in celebration mode after breaking the shackles to open the Super Rugby Pacific season with a rousing 36-12 derby win over the Queensland Reds in Sydney.

item.title: Musical Matches: Harpist Emily Granger and composer Tristan Coelho
item.description: For Valentine's Day, this Australian composer wrote his wife a harp concerto. She's about to premiere it with the Queensland Symphony Orchestra.

item.title: Chickens help autistic teen Summer Farrelly make sense of humans
item.description: While growing up, people didn't make much sense to Summer, but chickens always did. Now, Summer is using what they learnt to help other children with autism understand human interactions.

item.title: How Indonesians are fighting plummeting marriage rates
item.description: Marriage is still a life goal in Indonesia, but the number of marriages has plummeted over the past decade.

item.title: Remember Dollar Bill? It's been 60 years since Australia made the big change to decimal currency
item.description: Six decades ago, Australia swapped its old currency for dollars and cents. A catchy jingle sung by a cartoon character named Dollar Bill helped the country adapt.

item.title: Parents fail to return consent forms as Far North Queensland HPV vaccination rate drops
item.description: Cairns Public Health Unit says students are increasingly missing their school HPV vaccinations because they do not have parental consent.

item.title: Easy, tasty and nutritious recipes for sharing this Ramadan
item.description: Looking for easy, nutritious Ramadan recipes? These options will help you prepare for and break your fast well.

item.title: Scotty James left numb by the tragedy of 'almost' at 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games
item.description: Scotty James has sought what resides at the end of the Olympic rainbow his whole career. But for the third time, he's had to settle for the numbing pain of almost being an Olympic champion.

item.title: Jane Hume was punished for her election slips. Now she's been crowned deputy Liberal leader
item.description: The Victorian senator was unceremoniously turfed from Sussan Ley's ministry after being tarred personally with much of what went wrong in the Coalition's cataclysmic loss. On Friday, she ascended to the Liberal's second-in-command.

item.title: Broome man had to wait for someone to die to access dialysis in his hometown
item.description: Kimberley resident David Lawford had to wait in Perth until someone in his hometown died before he could get access to dialysis on his return.

item.title: Roads, homes, cars damaged as Alice Springs starts flash flood clean-up
item.description: With Alice Springs homes, businesses and roads damaged by flash flooding this week, the government is facing pressure to improve local flood mitigation measures.

item.title: Former AFL captain Dyson Heppell speaks about unhealthy relationship with food during playing career
item.description: Former Essendon captain Dyson Heppell has spoken about the unhealthy relationship he had with food early in his career.

item.title: Wool price jumps ahead of industry-first Chinese New Year break
item.description: As wool growers enjoy their best prices since 2019, the market will now pause to respect China's request for a week off to celebrate Lunar New Year.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 8
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Major construction starts on Adelaide's first skyscraper Festival Tower Two
item.description: Festival Tower Two is set to tower over South Australia's Parliament House, which the premier says will bring money and people into the city, but others remain against the $800 million project.

item.title: The US government has just entered another shutdown. Here's what it means this time
item.description: After Congress failed to pass laws necessary to fully fund the US government, one of its biggest departments has shut down.

item.title: Laura Peel's Olympic journey ends before even stepping onto snow at 2026 Milano Cortina Games
item.description: Instead of the glint of gold, Laura Peel's lasting Olympic memory will be the glittering diamonds of despair in Zhangjiakou, with the 36-year-old ruled out of the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milano Cortina after suffering a knee injury on the eve of the Games.

item.title: Jakara Anthony wins dual moguls gold at 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics
item.description: Jakara Anthony achieves Winter Olympic redemption, claiming a stunning gold medal in the women's dual moguls.

item.title: Taylor faces formidable task rebuilding Liberals' electoral fortunes
item.description: The paralysing uncertainty that weighed on the Liberals' faces has lifted for now, but morale in politics follows results rather than reshuffles.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Jakara Anthony responds to adversity and delivers a golden reply she sorely deserved
item.description: Jakara Anthony stared down adversity, swallowed back her pain, and delivered a performance for the ages to become Australia's greatest Winter Olympian.

item.title: What we know (and don't) about One Nation's rapid rise in the polls
item.description: Pauline Hanson's One Nation has seen the fastest polling rise in modern Australian politics. What is going on?

item.title: Director Sophie Hyde unpacks long-held family secrets in her latest film Jimpa
item.description: Sophie Hyde's films have won awards at Sundance and Berlin, but she has more riding on her latest release. She's turned the lens on the long-held secrets of her unconventional family.

item.title: Sophie Hyde’s dad came out when she was a baby. It shaped three generations.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Rise of Australia's public economy is comparable to the mining boom of the 2000s, analyst says
item.description: Long-term structural shifts have gravitational forces that are hard to escape, says a Westpac economist.

item.title: Winter Olympics legend Eugenio Monti, the Italian sledder who helped his rivals win gold
item.description: As Bree Walker aims to create Olympic history in the women's monobob, she will do so on a track named after a man who made history of his own through one of the Winter Games' most selfless acts.

item.title: These mums raise other people's children to secure a future for their own
item.description: A generation of children in South-East Asia are growing up without their mothers, who have to work abroad for decades to make ends meet.

item.title: Alex de Minaur through to ATP Rotterdam Open final with win over Ugo Humbert
item.description: Alex de Minaur becomes the first man to reach three consecutive finals at the Rotterdam Open.

item.title: Researchers warn climate-linked disease leptospirosis spreading south
item.description: Researchers say leptospirosis is emerging as a climate‑driven health threat in Australia, with frequent storms, floods and heatwaves pushing the disease further south.

item.title: ACT Brumbies defeat Western Force 56-24 in Super Rugby Pacific
item.description: The ACT Brumbies have turned up the heat to blitz the Western Force 56-24 in a sapping season-opening Super Rugby Pacific clash in Perth.

item.title: Dry January hits southern Australia as east coast lows drop off the radar
item.description: Rainfall was below average for most of Australia's south-east, far-west and central regions in the first month of the year.

item.title: How a pocket of Sydney's inner west went from Australia's deepest coal mine to waterfront houses
item.description: What was once a working class, coal-fuelled borough is now a sought-after suburb in Sydney's inner west, with houses selling for millions.

item.title: Destanee Aiava announces retirement, calls out online trolls and 'racist' tennis culture
item.description: Australian tennis player Destanee Aiava says 2026 will be her last year in professional tennis, announcing her impending retirement in an expletive-laden statement on social media.

item.title: South Molle's damaged jetty restricts access to island, with abandoned resort's future unclear
item.description: South Molle Island's former resort has been abandoned since it was damaged by a cyclone in 2017. Now, public access to the island is restricted after Cyclone Koji wreaked havoc on its jetty.

item.title: Woodstock Farm program helping steer troubled Queensland youth away from life of crime
item.description: The rural-based social program in the shadow of Mt Tamborine has had remarkable success in rebuilding the lives of youth who have fallen through the cracks.

item.title: Faaletino Tavana scores stunning try in NRL trial, Canterbury Bulldogs star Matt Burton limps off
item.description: Wests Tigers rookie Faaletino Tavana has laid claim to one of the best tries in 2026 during a preseason trial against the Sydney Roosters.

item.title: Easy ways to help protect your hair from chlorine and saltwater damage
item.description: Regular beach days or laps at the local pool can leave our hair looking and feeling quite different.

item.title: Unscrupulous NDIS providers using inducements to recruit remote NT participants
item.description: People with disabilities in remote Northern Territory communities are being targeted by unscrupulous NDIS providers using high-pressure sales tactics and inducements including cash, cigarettes and alcohol, an ABC investigation can reveal.

item.title: AFL State of Origin coaches hail success of concept following Victoria's win over Western Australia
item.description: Winning Victoria coach Chris Scott and his Western Australia counterpart Dean Cox call for State of Origin to be played every year after the concept's stunning return in Perth.

item.title: Alice Springs childcare centre cleared of wrongdoing following police investigation
item.description: Investigations into allegations surrounding an Alice Springs childcare centre are finalised, with no charges laid.

item.title: NSW premier announces extra public holiday in April for Anzac Day
item.description: New South Wales has the fewest public holidays in Australia, observing only 11.

item.title: Supporting and connecting Deaf people, Olivia finds her calling more than just a job
item.description: Olivia Jackson, who lost her hearing as a child, has felt invisible for over a decade until she found her true calling to help other Deaf people achieve their goals as a support worker.

item.title: Statues of Amy Sherwin, Australia's first opera star, unveiled at Hobart's Hadley's Hotel in bid to cement legacy
item.description: An effort to bring new recognition to a Tasmanian opera star who became world famous, but who died poor, culminates in the unveiling of two statues of her in Hobart.

item.title: Indigenous side overturns 14-0 deficit to down Maori in women's All Stars
item.description: The Indigenous team overturns a 14-0 deficit to score a rousing comeback win over the Maori in the Women's All Stars clash.

item.title: Charlotte Mortlock quits Liberal Party following Sussan Ley leadership defeat
item.description: Women were less likely to vote for the Coalition at the 2025 election than ever before, according to the Australian Election Study.

item.title: WA government to introduce new laws on hate speech, face coverings and protests
item.description: The WA premier flags new legislation on hate speech and protests in a bid to protect "social cohesion" in the wake of "multiple threats across Australia" over the summer.

item.title: Chinese star takes swipe at organisers for not accommodating her schedule
item.description: Chinese skiing superstar Eileen Gu says she is "disappointed" and "saddened" that Winter Olympics organisers scheduled halfpipe training at the same time as her big air final at the MIlano Cortina Games.

item.title: City of Melbourne quiet on plan for Southbank's 'ugly' red stairs, long after design competition announced
item.description: A Melbourne council unveiled a lucrative competition to replace Southbank's much-derided red stairs. But a year after it was due to start, the plan appears to have gone nowhere.

item.title: What is FAFO parenting and is it good for kids?
item.description: Is FAFO the 1980s parenting style today's generation of kids need, rebellion against gentle child-rearing, or exhausted parents just throwing their hands in the air?

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: The anxiety and joy of dual moguls bronze for Matt Graham, leader and captain of the Australian team
item.description: Matt Graham's brilliant bronze in the dual moguls, and the incredible response from his teammates, proved to everyone that he is the true leader of this Winter Olympic squad.

item.title: AI is evolving fast and may bring the fourth industrial revolution with it
item.description: A fake news story about me, a series of AI breakthroughs and a resignation in the tech world show that 2026 could be pivotal for AI.

item.title: Alex de Minaur claims Rotterdam Open with impressive victory over Felix Auger-Aliassime
item.description: An inspired Alex de Minaur produces one of the biggest wins of his career, lifting the Rotterdam Open title by beating red-hot Felix Auger-Aliassime.

item.title: Whooping cough cases hit record high after 'potentially catastrophic' vaccine rate drop
item.description: A "potentially catastrophic" decline in Australia's childhood vaccination rates has contributed to the sharpest increase in cases of whooping cough in 35 years, infectious diseases experts say.

item.title: Australia defeated by India in opening T20 as Sophie Molineux era gets off to wobbly start
item.description: Australia slumps to a rain-affected 21-run loss to India in their opening T20 at the SCG, after selectors opted to drop vice-captain Tahlia McGrath.

item.title: Shark population may have fallen prey to algal bloom, SA ecologists fear
item.description: South Australia's algal bloom could be responsible for pushing a local population of sharks to the brink of collapse, some researchers say.

item.title: India and Pakistan refuse handshakes before and after contentious T20 World Cup clash
item.description: India and Pakistan decline to shake hands before and after the most-anticipated game of the T20 World Cup, with India easily winning by 61 runs to secure its Super 8 spot.

item.title: Cape Barren Island uses greenhouse and traditional foods to keep fridges full
item.description: A tiny island off the coast of Tasmania is embracing old and new techniques to keep food on the table.

item.title: Rescuers race to find entangled whale last seen near Wilsons Promontory
item.description: Authorities are looking for a juvenile humpback whale last seen entangled in rope off the coast near Wilsons Promontory.

item.title: Queensland school teacher calls for endometriosis support after fundraising for surgery
item.description: After years of unsuccessful endometriosis treatments, Inez Goves underwent a hysterectomy thanks to an online fundraiser. But her symptoms returned, prompting more surgery and calls for greater support for the illness.

item.title: Sydney scientist collects wild roadside apples to produce cider
item.description: Lucien Alperstein has spent the past decade picking feral apples from trees along country back roads and making cider. They say their guerilla activity inspired their curiosity about the science of genetics and fermentation.

item.title: Chalmers mocks Taylor's proposal for bipartisan budget savings taskforce
item.description: Angus Taylor wrote to the prime minister pitching the plan just days after being elected leader of the Liberal Party.

item.title: SA Police return to Oak Park Station in Gus Lamont missing person investigation
item.description: Officers are at Oak Park Station in South Australia's north-east, where a four-year-old boy went missing almost five months ago.

item.title: Antarctic type B killer whales seen for first time near WA's Bremer Bay
item.description: Sightings of Antarctic orcas in Australian waters are very rare. A tour group in WA saw what appeared to be a pod of Antarctic type B killer whales muscle in and steal the meal of a local group of orcas.

item.title: Senior Liberals deny involvement in draft policy to ban migrants from Gaza
item.description: A leaked copy of the Liberal Party's migration policy prepared before Sussan Ley was ousted included plans to "elevate" the current non-binding Australian values statement.

item.title: NRL opens door for New Zealand and England internationals to play State of Origin
item.description: New South Wales and Queensland can now select players who are New Zealand and England internationals after the NRL confirmed a major change to the State of Origin eligibility rules.

item.title: ACCC accuses Coles of 'planned' campaign to mislead customers
item.description: Supermarket giant Coles is accused of a "planned" campaign to mislead customers over discounts on the first day of a bombshell Federal Court case.

item.title: Man accused of Caboolture museum heist allegedly believed it was his 'duty' to return artefacts to 'rightful place', court told
item.description: Miguel Simon Mungarrieta Monsalve has been charged with a range of offences after he allegedly broke into a Caboolture museum on Friday morning.

item.title: Maugean skate still faces 'catastrophic' risk from salmon farming, Commonwealth advice says
item.description: Official advice is unequivocal that salmon farming remains the main threat to the endangered Maugean skate. It remains to be seen if the federal environment minister will ask Tasmanian salmon farms to scale back their operations.

item.title: Hospital boss says changes already made at child gender service criticised in review
item.description: Advocates have called for for better regional services after a Cairns children gender clinic was restricted following a scathing report.

item.title: Protester takes to roof of Geraldton fisheries building over WA government's demersal fishing ban
item.description: A Geraldton fisherman locks himself to the roof of a government building — and says he has swallowed the key — in a protest over Cook government restrictions.

item.title: Remote WA communities isolated and roads closed after weekend deluge
item.description: Major roads and remote communities are cut off by floodwaters after a deluge of rain in Western Australia's far north.

item.title: Canberra woman allegedly held captive for two days and raped was 'subdued with violence', court hears
item.description: A woman who fled naked into a Canberra street and told police she thought she was going to die had just escaped two days of alleged violent captivity, a jury has heard.

item.title: Monday Finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Aussie Walker finishes outside of medals at Milano Cortina Games
item.description: Australia's Bree Walker missed a spot on the podium but still managed a top-eight placing in the monobob at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics.

item.title: Australian women and children with links to ISIS forced to head back to camp in Syria
item.description: A group of Australian families with links to Islamic State fighters are forced to turn around after leaving a camp in Syria to try and begin their journey home to Australia.

item.title: 'Devastated' Australia on the brink of World Cup exit after Sri Lanka's record chase
item.description: Australia is on the cusp of a group stage exit from the T20 World Cup after crashing to an eight-wicket loss against tournament co-hosts Sri Lanka.

item.title: North Korea builds homes for families of soldiers killed fighting in Ukraine
item.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un unveils new housing development in the country's capital, Pyongyang, to repay the "young martyrs" killed fighting in Ukraine.

item.title: Ukrainian ex-minister Herman Halushchenko accused of stashing laundered millions offshore
item.description: Ukraine's anti-corruption police have accused its ex-energy minister of helping launder kickbacks and stashing millions offshore, a day after he was detained trying to leave the country.

item.title: Angus Taylor bets on migration politics amid global rightward shift
item.description: If migration is treated primarily as a cultural fault line, rather than an economic system embedded in national growth, the debate will remain loud. The structural reform will remain unfinished.

item.title: Robert Duvall, star of The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, dies at 95
item.description: Oscar winner Robert Duvall, known for films such as The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, has died at the age of 95.

item.title: How to decide what type of car insurance is best for you
item.description: Choosing the right car insurance option can feel daunting, but it's the kind of task that it pays to get right. So, how can you decide which type is most suitable for you?

item.title: Tradies consider leaving careers over lack of onsite toilets
item.description: Tradies are walking out. Not over ability or aptitude but toilets — in a symbol of the sector's persistent barriers.

item.title: Interest rate hike worries? Here's some good news
item.description: Fresh warnings of further rate rises have been enough to send shivers up the collective spine of new homeowners, but if there's any comfort to be had, it's this: Don't believe a word of the forecasts.

item.title: Carlton's Jacob Weitering suffers rib fracture after AFL State of Origin, but cleared of other injuries
item.description: Carlton star Jacob Weitering has received some good news, with the Blues labelling their injured vice-captain as a "good chance" to feature in opening round.

item.title: Irish rugby to investigate racial abuse towards Test debutant Edwin Edogbo
item.description: The Irish Rugby Football Union has said it will launch an investigation after turning comments off a social media post that congratulated the country's newest Test debutant.

item.title: Police likely looking for motive during renewed search for Gus Lamont, retired detective says
item.description: Police are again at remote Oak Park Station searching for evidence related to the disappearance of missing four-year-old Gus Lamont, with a retired police officer saying detectives are likely "looking for a motive".

item.title: Ex-footballer shot multiple times in Western Sydney drive-by shooting
item.description: Police have been told Matt Utai, who played for the Tigers and Bulldogs NRL clubs, was shot outside a home on the street by the occupants of an SUV, before they fled the scene.

item.title: Reducing run-off from macadamia farms improves soil but more needed to boost waterways
item.description: A new study backs up the agricultural and environmental benefits of certain macadamia farming practices, but the industry says there is still a long way to go in improving waterway health.

item.title: Illegal fishing vessels threaten Australia's agricultural sector as biosecurity concerns grow
item.description: Australian primary producers say they are concerned about the risk of foreign pests crippling entire industries if overseas fishing boats continue to enter the nation's waters illegally.

item.title: Bushwalkers soak in near 'once-in-a-lifetime' waterfall after cyclone in WA's Pilbara
item.description: The question of whether there is water in Python Pool is often asked around the pubs and message boards of WA's Pilbara. For the moment, the answer is very much yes.

item.title: Own goal ends Macclesfield's FA Cup fairytale against Brentford
item.description: Non-league English football club Macclesfield's tremendous FA Cup run has come to an end, falling to Premier League side Brentford.

item.title: Pod Save America and why Australians remain obssessed with US politics
item.description: Huge crowds have flocked to live shows for the popular and influential Pod Save America podcast, suggesting Australia's obsession with US politics isn't going away anytime soon.

item.title: Australia leads the world in moguls skiing. This is why
item.description: To the surprise of many, the "beach nation" that is Australia is the best moguls skiing nation on earth. How the team got there is no accident.

item.title: Austrian man faces terror charges over Taylor Swift concert plot
item.description: Austrian prosecutors have filed terrorism-related charges against a 21-year-old man who they say planned to carry out an Islamist militant attack at one of Taylor Swift's 2024 concerts in Vienna.

item.title: Nurses vote to go on strike at Lyell McEwin Hospital as SA government gives immediate pay rise
item.description: Nurses and midwives at the Lyell McEwin Hospital remain set to walk off the job for 24 hours on Thursday, with the union saying the government's decision to introduce an immediate 4 per cent pay rise still falls short of expectations.

item.title: Hang-gliding soars as more competitors leap into the sport
item.description: Bruce Atkinson taught himself to fly with a textbook, but says this daredevil sport has evolved a lot since then.

item.title: Highly infectious 'Super-K' flu strain blamed for skyrocketing cases in Queensland
item.description: Increasingly low vaccination rates, more summer indoor gatherings and a new mutation of a highly infectious strain are driving the spike in flu cases, experts say.

item.title: WA's illegal tobacco crackdown comes after less than $89,000 in fines issued last year
item.description: Amid moves to increase penalties for those involved in the illegal tobacco trade, Western Australian authorities are slammed for handing out just $88,100 in fines last year.

item.title: One man dead, two people critically injured in 'random' Sydney stabbing attack
item.description: Police were told on arrival at the scene in Merrylands that a man stabbed multiple people before leaving the area on foot.

item.title: Nancy Guthrie's family cleared as suspects in her disappearance
item.description: Nancy Guthrie's family members, including her children and their spouses, have been cleared as possible suspects in her abduction as the case enters its third week.

item.title: AFL Opening Round concept is 'unbelievably important', Tom Harley says
item.description: AFL chief operating officer Tom Harley insists the league's polarising Opening Round is here to stay, declaring it crucial to the competition's growth in northern markets.

item.title: Former ACT commissioner Vanessa Turnbull-Roberts accuses public servant of sexual assault
item.description: Vanessa Turnbull-Roberts says she stepped down as the ACT's first Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander children and young people commissioner to prioritise her safety after being subjected to sexual harassment and sexual assault by a public servant.

item.title: Tasmanian government forging ahead with Wilkinsons Point sale to JackJumpers' owner despite advice
item.description: The Tasmanian government is pushing ahead with plans to sell 15 hectares of publicly-owned land to the owner of the JackJumpers NBL team despite receiving departmental advice to stop negotiations.

item.title: Peterborough District Council loses fifth CEO since 2024 with latest sacked after two months
item.description: Peterborough District Council has sacked its latest CEO less than two months into her role. The council in regional South Australia has gone through five CEOs in two years.

item.title: Four men again jailed for life for killing Albanian refugee Urim Gjabri in Adelaide
item.description: Four men who faced a retrial over the murder of Albanian refugee Urim Gjabri in Adelaide's north in 2018 are again jailed for life, with the judge saying their crime was motivated by "greed and [a] desire to rob him of the cannabis".

item.title: Angus Taylor reveals shadow ministry, elevating Andrew Hastie and Jacinta Nampijinpa Price
item.description: The new Liberal leader announces his shadow ministry, elevating prominent right-faction supporters including West Australian MP Andrew Hastie.

item.title: ABC Radio Perth's move to switch to FM aims for better news delivery
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Liam Alexander Hall revealed as man charged over alleged terrorism act at Perth Invasion Day rally
item.description: The man accused of throwing a bomb at Invasion Day protesters in an alleged terrorism act attack in Perth can be named as Liam Alexander Hall.

item.title: Woman tells Queensland child safety inquiry of abuse and lack of support in state care
item.description: A Queensland woman whose adolescence was marred by sexual abuse and exploitation has described her experiences in residential care to Queensland's Child Safety Commission of Inquiry.

item.title: Marquee Canterbury recruit Leo Thompson to miss 10 weeks following calf injury
item.description: Canterbury are dealt a hammer blow for their Las Vegas trip and beyond with prop Leo Thompson ruled out for 10 weeks due to a calf injury.

item.title: Fire crews battle blaze south of Launceston
item.description: The Tasmania Fire Service has downgraded an emergency bushfire warning for an area south of Launceston, with helicopters and ground crews in attendance.

item.title: Kyneton women's football players greenlit to join Central Victorian Football League
item.description: A long-running saga in country women's football is set to close as a central Victorian team that had been left without a competition will now be allowed to play in 2026.

item.title: WAAPA buildings to be re-purposed for creative industries as part of ECU Mount Lawley redevelopment
item.description: A "creative industries hub" and around 1,000 new homes will be built on the former Edith Cowan University (ECU) campus in Mount Lawley — but the site's makeover will take 10 to 15 years.

item.title: Mobil Oil Australia to pay $16m fine for misleading claims about fuel sold in Queensland
item.description: The ACCC said Mobil advertised its Mobil Synergy fuel but did not actually supply the product at the time.

item.title: SA government open to swim safety signs at airport as foreign-born drownings increase
item.description: The number of drownings in Australia has surged in recent times, but with nearly a third of victims being foreign-born, the ABC has asked if installing airport signage about the rips, waves and powerful currents at our beaches could help.

item.title: Hundreds attend state funeral for Ted Egan, former NT administrator, folk musician and land rights champion
item.description: Hundreds of people have gathered to remember former NT administrator, musician and Indigenous land rights advocate Ted Egan, at a state funeral held in Alice Springs today.

item.title: Why Brisbane's fuel prices have been cheaper than usual
item.description: A combination of economic factors means Brisbane motorists have experienced below-average fuel prices for an extended period.

item.title: French Polynesia drug haul hits $2.4 billion in a month as third shipment intercepted
item.description: French authorities seized a 2.4-tonne drug shipment near French Polynesia during a joint operation with the United States.

item.title: TAFE chief executive resigns as Charles Darwin University reveals impact of course errors
item.description: The number of carpentry apprentices impacted by a Charles Darwin University blunder that will force them back to school has grown to more than 130 people.

item.title: Iran launches military drill as US deploys aircraft carrier on eve of nuclear talks
item.description: Representatives from the two nations are set to meet in Geneva on Tuesday, local time, as US President Donald Trump tries to curb Tehran's nuclear program.

item.title: High-pitched anti-homeless noise devices switched off and labelled 'hostile' by WA government
item.description: High-pitched noise devices installed under a bridge to deter rough sleepers are labelled "unnecessary" and "humiliating" by housing campaigners and condemned by the WA government.

item.title: Internal review finds almost half of all Queensland Health doctors at risk of burnout
item.description: More than 2,000 doctors responded to the Medical Workforce Wellbeing Survey last year, which polled the wellbeing of medical clinicians state-wide.

item.title: Australian production company Matchbox Pictures to be closed by Universal International Studios
item.description: Matchbox Pictures, the local production house behind Dog Park, The Survivors and Secret City, will be closed by its international parent company, Universal International Studios.

item.title: The Missing number in the hundreds of thousands in Syria, where mass graves of torture victims are found weekly
item.description: Victims of Syria's brutal Assad regime were tortured to death in completely horrible and inhumane ways. The relatives of "The Missing" are still searching for them as their numbers continue to explode.

item.title: Addin Fonua-Blake and Briton Nikora embrace chance to play State of Origin following eligibility changes
item.description: Cronulla duo Briton Nikora and Addin Fonua-Blake have both praised the rule changes that will give the pair a chance at State of Origin football they thought had long passed them by.

item.title: Private health premiums to rise at fastest rate in almost a decade
item.description: Private health insurance premiums will rise at their fastest rate in almost a decade, after the federal government approved a 4.41 per cent average increase from April.

item.title: Jury shown footage of alleged attack on Strathmerton postmaster John Burke
item.description: A jury in the trial of Troy Maskell, accused of the manslaughter death of 73-year-old John Burke, has watched CCTV footage of the alleged incident.

item.title: Police drop charges against WIM Resource employee accused of falsifying documents
item.description: Victoria Police has dropped all charges against WIM Resource employee Murray Wilson, who worked on the controversial Avonbank Mineral Sands Project.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Mother of former Manly player Keith Titmuss breaks silence on lawsuit against NRL club
item.description: The mother of Manly player Keith Titmuss, who died of exertional heat stroke following a 2020 Sea Eagles training session, breaks her silence on her family's multi-million-dollar lawsuit against the NRL club.

item.title: Man arrested after fatal Merrylands stabbing escaped care 10 days before attack, health authorities say
item.description: A man arrested after a fatal stabbing in Merrylands escaped from mental health care while being transferred between hospitals more than a week ago, health authorities say.

item.title: Father whose son died in house fire accuses lawyer at coronial inquiry of 'degrading him'
item.description: The father, in an emotional outburst, told the inquest he had spent thousands of dollars on psychiatric and hypnotherapy appointments so he could move on from the tragedy.

item.title: ABC to move Adelaide office to new Tapangka site in CBD
item.description: The ABC has announced a new location for its Adelaide operations, moving to a new arts and media hub alongside other government arts organisation in the CBD.

item.title: Grammy-winning songwriter and hitmaker Billy Steinberg dies aged 75
item.description: Award-winning US songwriter Billy Steinberg, who wrote several top hit songs including Madonna's Like a Virgin, died on Monday aged 75, according to media reports.

item.title: Live: Aerials action to kick off day 11 at Milano Cortina
item.description: Australia's men's and women's aerials are up in qualification on day 11 at the Winter Olympics and later on, 16-year-old Ally Hickman will chase a medal in the women's slopestyle final. Follow live.

item.title: Jesse Jackson, civil rights leader and US presidential hopeful, dead at 84
item.description: Mr Jackson died peacefully surrounded by his family on Tuesday morning, local time, his family said.
